Issues.Title: Error when updating from 7 to 8. TypeError: Cannot read property '_metadataResolver' of undefined
Issues.Body:
I have a multi-project angular project which is in angular v.7.2.2, although not using the library functionality.

I have tried to update the project 3 times. This time updating all other dependencies and always getting the same error which doesn't tell me anything:

Error when updating from 7 to 8. TypeError: Cannot read property '_metadataResolver' of undefined.

This is the full output when running ng update @angular/core --from 7 --to 8 --migrate-only (after seeing this message before)

  ------ Static Query Migration ------
            With Angular version 8, developers need to
            explicitly specify the timing of ViewChild and
            ContentChild queries. Read more about this here:
            https://v8.angular.io/guide/static-query-migration

            The template migration strategy uses the Angular compiler internally and therefore projects that no longer build successfully after the update cannot use the template migration strategy. Please ensure there are no AOT compilation errors.

            Could not setup migration strategy for "src/tsconfig.app.json". The following error has been reported:

            TypeError: Cannot read property '_metadataResolver' of undefined

            Migration can be rerun with: "ng update @angular/core --from 7 --to 8 --migrate-only"

            ------------------------------------------------
Two or more projects are using identical roots. Unable to determine project using current working directory. Using default workspace project instead.
Two or more projects are using identical roots. Unable to determine project using current working directory. Using default workspace project instead.
            ------ Renderer to Renderer2 Migration ------
            As of Angular 9, the Renderer class is no longer available.
            Renderer2 should be used instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error when updating from 7 to 8. TypeError: Cannot read property '_metadataResolver' of undefined" (#32741)

Issues.Title: test(language-service): remove MockData from MockTypescriptHost
Issues.Body:
Remove MockData from the constructor parameters of MockTypescriptHost
since the entire Tour of Heroes (TOH) project is now loaded from disk.

Added a new method `reset()` to MockTypescriptHost that is necessary to
reset the state of the project before each spec if run to make sure
previous overrides are cleared.

Issues.Title: [Ivy] ASSERTION ERROR: Should be run in update mode

# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core (Ivy) ### Is this a regression? Yes, works in non-Ivy. ### Description I suspect this happens as a result of having an Input property that is set directly (`isExpanded="true"`) instead of using a binding (`[isExpanded]="true"`), and having the property setter call `changeDetectorRef.detectChanges()`. It should be noted that this works in non-ivy. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/fr0/angular-test/tree/ivy ## üî• Exception or Error

    at postProcessDirective (core.js:13335)
    at instantiateAllDirectives (core.js:13234)

Issues.Title: Clarify OnInit interface in Getting Started guide
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description The **Getting Started guide** mentions the `ngOnInit` method early on in the **Your First App** section but it is not clear what does this method actually doing. On the contrary, it is mentioned in the tutorial tour of heroes in the **Hero Editor** section. > The ngOnInit() is a lifecycle hook. Angular calls ngOnInit() shortly after creating a component. It's a good place to put initialization logic. From a beginner's point of view, it would make more sense to include this information in the Getting Started guide. What do you think? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/start https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt1 ### Reproduction Steps** ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Angular 8 -> Angular 9 breaks with ng2-charts
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package `ng2-charts` https://github.com/valor-software/ng2-charts ### Is this a regression? Angular 8.2.6 works Angular 9.0.0-next.5 fails ### Description Everything works as expected with 8.2.6 Upgrading to 9.0.0-next.5 fails to build (Ivy disabled, aot enabled) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I created a repository: https://github.com/whyboris/angular-ivy-problem-2 It was created with `npm install -g @angular/cli@next` and `ng new angular-ivy-problem-2` which runs. But simply adding `ng2-charts` fails compilation; see PR: https://github.com/whyboris/angular-ivy-problem-2/pull/1/files It is easy to fix, by simply downgrading from angular 9 to angular 8; see PR: https://github.com/whyboris/angular-ivy-problem-2/pull/2/files Another fix is to upgrade from `ng2-charts` version `1.6.0` to latest (`2.3.0`), see PR: https://github.com/whyboris/angular-ivy-problem-2/pull/3/files ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Expand email validation description in API doc
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
Email validation pattern is not described, making it difficult to decide between `Validators.email()` and `Validators.pattern()`.

Issue Number:  
https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/18985
https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/25186

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/architect): support accessing project metadata
Issues.Body:
This eliminates the need to manually read a workspace file and removes the use of the experimental workspace API from the `@angular-devkit/build-angular` package.

The `BuilderContext` now provides a `getProjectMetadata` function that provides the `root`, `sourceRoot`, `prefix`, and any custom extension fields from the project definition within `angular.json`.

Issues.Title: Ivy marks unassigned but used child interfaces as unused with compiler warning.
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ x] new - [ x] build - [ x] serve ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description Ivy incorrectly identifies interfaces as unused that compose parts of an object returned from an API endpoint. i.e. Type A that contains Type B, if Type B is never assigned to and is in it's own TS file, Ivy generates warnings that Type B is not an entry point. ### Workarounds: - Move the interface into the same file as the parent object interface. - Inline the child interface into the parent interface rather than defining a new type. - Define A.B as \ rather than strongly typing it. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/fivedice/ivy-warnings See the ReadMe.md for specific example in the repo. ## üî• Exception or Error 

WARNING in /Users/jyoutsey/src/fivedice/ivy-warnings/src/app/currency.ts is part of the TypeScript compilation but it's unused.
Add only entry points to the 'files' or 'include' properties in your tsconfig.

WARNING in /Users/jyoutsey/src/fivedice/ivy-warnings/src/environments/environment.prod.ts is part of the TypeScript compilation but it's unused.
Add only entry points to the 'files' or 'include' properties in your tsconfig.
## üåç Your Environment

Node: 10.16.0
OS: darwin x64

### BREAKING CHANGES

`ts_library` strict dependencies now apply to libraries from npm.
You can use `deps=["@​npm//:node_modules"]` to depend on all node_modules, but this has performance implications.
We suggest adding missing dependencies individually to the `deps` of the `ts_library`, following guidance from the compile errors.

### Changes

New `check_bazel_version_range` function to ensure your team uses the Bazel version you require

We automatically generate a named UMD bundle at `@npm//node_modules/package:package.umd.js` so that the concatjs bundler can work with third-party libraries.

`ts_library` now automatically gathers typings from npm packages in the `deps`.

`web_package`

-   Support the same root paths as `ts_devserver`, fix for [#​728](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/728)

Issues.Title: older (es5) browsers not fully supported when using workspace scripts
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version I'm aware this was still working was 8.0. ### Description Since I upgraded the cli to 8.3.3 my applications do not provide support for older browsers such as IE11. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create a new project. ``` npx -p @angular/cli@8.3.3 ng new es5-support ``` 2. Change the browsers list file to consider IE 9-11 (remove `not` as suggested in the comments): ``` > 0.5% last 2 versions Firefox ESR not dead IE 9-11 ``` 3. Create a custom script that uses, for example, Promises: ``` const myPromise = new Promise(function(resolve) { setTimeout(function(){ resolve('Promise resolved'); }, 500); }); myPromise.then(console.log); ``` 4. Add this script to the build target (angular.json): ``` ... "architect": { "build": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser", "options": { "outputPath": "dist/es5-support", "index": "src/index.html", "main": "src/main.ts", "polyfills": "src/polyfills.ts", "tsConfig": "tsconfig.app.json", "aot": false, "assets": [ "src/favicon.ico", "src/assets" ], "styles": [ "src/styles.css" ], "scripts": [ "my-script.js" ] }, ... ``` 5. Build the application: ``` ng build --prod ``` 6. Deploy and run the application on IE11. Here is a repo that reproduces the error: https://github.com/cladera/ng-cli-es5-support ## üî• Exception or Error 

SCRIPT5009: 'Promise' is undefined
File: scripts.31a5e5bdf3ecf1f1be1c.js, Line: 1, Column: 1
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 8.3.4
Node: 12.3.1
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 8.2.6
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.803.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.803.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.803.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.803.4
@angular-devkit/core              8.3.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        8.3.4
@angular/cli                      8.3.4
@ngtools/webpack                  8.3.4
@schematics/angular               8.3.4
@schematics/update                0.803.4
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.5.3
webpack                           4.39.2
**Anything else relevant?** If I run the build with the environment flag `NG_BUILD_DIFFERENTIAL_FULL` set to `1` it runs a build that does work on IE 11. Anyway, one may wonder why do I need to add a script to my application that may break it whatsoever. Well, in an ideal world, all the libraries I need would be full UMD/cmjs compatible and I may just import them as a normal vendor dependency. But sadly, that's not my case. I need to add some scripts as "global" because I'm forced to do it. My point is, this worked fine few minor versions ago and now it doesn't which in my opinion is a breaking change.

Issues.Title: CSS selector :not(:read-only) has no effect with configuration production
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x] build - [x] serve ``` ### Is this a regression? I don't know. The issue is present in Angular 7.3.9 and 8.3.4 ### Description Using a `&:not(:read-only)` selector works fine using `ng serve` but does not work using `ng serve --prod`. Same is true for `ng build`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction * Minimal example Angular 7.3.9: https://github.com/mab/readonly * Minimal example Angular 8.3.4: https://github.com/mab/readonly8 ### Manual steps to reproduce 1. `ng new readonly8 --style=scss` 2. Adapt `app.component.html` ``` Readonly
Writable ``` 3. Adapt `app.component.scss` ``` input[type='text'] { &:read-only { border: none; } &:not(:read-only) { border: 1px solid red; } } ``` 4. Run `ng serve` -> result as expected ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/207018/65036909-d2452700-d94c-11e9-839b-b925f3630511.png) 5. Run `ng serve --prod` -> `:not` selector does not work ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/207018/65036992-0c162d80-d94d-11e9-9503-0d9ed10cd01f.png) ## üî• Exception or Error There are no exceptions or errors. # üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->

```

- [ ] update

### Description

In my SSR app after Angular upgrade from 7.2 to 8.2.5, index.html is not generated in `./dist/browser`. I am running build with `ng build -c production` command. It's very weird that in dev mode (`ng serve`) everything is working fine.

Issues.Title: Windows 10 @angular/cli install problem
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report
npm install fails on windows 10

### Description

    npm install -g @angular/cli

the above command fails with the following output:

    C:\Users\zebal\scoop\persist\nodejs\bin\ng -> C:\Users\zebal\scoop\persist\nodejs\bin\node_modules\@angular\cli\bin\ng
    
    > @angular/cli@8.3.4 postinstall C:\Users\zebal\scoop\persist\nodejs\bin\node_modules\@angular\cli
    > node ./bin/postinstall/script.js
    
    C:\Users\zebal\scoop\persist\nodejs\bin\node_modules\@angular\cli\bin\postinstall\analytics-prompt.js:8
    (async () => {
           ^
    SyntaxError: Unexpected token (
        at createScript (vm.js:56:10)
        at Object.runInThisContext (vm.js:97:10)
        at Module._compile (module.js:542:28)
        at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:579:10)
        at Module.load (module.js:487:32)
        at tryModuleLoad (module.js:446:12)
        at Function.Module._load (module.js:438:3)
        at Module.require (module.js:497:17)
        at require (internal/module.js:20:19)
        at Object.<anonymous> (C:\Users\zebal\scoop\persist\nodejs\bin\node_modules\@angular\cli\bin\postinstall\script.js:5:1)
    npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
    npm ERR! errno 1
    npm ERR! @angular/cli@8.3.4 postinstall: `node ./bin/postinstall/script.js`
    npm ERR! Exit status 1
    npm ERR!
    npm ERR! Failed at the @angular/cli@8.3.4 postinstall script.
    npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.
    
    npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
    npm ERR!     C:\Users\zebal\scoop\persist\nodejs\cache\_logs\2019-09-17T05_00_22_275Z-debug.log

npm version: 6.10.3
nodejs version: 12.10.0
windows10 version: 1909

-   **ivy:** guard listening to outputs with isDirectiveHost ([#​32495](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/32495)) ([527ce3b](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/527ce3b))
-   **ivy:** initialise TNode inputs / outputs on the first creation pass ([#​32608](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/32608)) ([ad178c5](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/ad178c5))

-   **language-service:** keep analyzedModules cache when source files don't change ([#​32562](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/32562)) ([4f03323](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/4f03323))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **ivy:** Translations (loaded via the `loadTranslations()` function) must now use
    `MessageId` for the translation key rather than the previous `SourceMessage`
    string.
-   **ivy:** To attach the `$localize` function to the global scope import from
    `@angular/localize/init`. Previously it was `@angular/localize`. To access the `loadTranslations()` and `clearTranslations()` functions,

##### DEPRECATIONS

-   **core:** TestBed.get function is marked as deprecated, use TestBed.inject instead.

Issues.Title: Ng lint produces to multiple xml content in single file
Issues.Body:
# üêû Ng lint produces to Multiple XML content in single file

### 
```
- [ x] new
- [x ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [x ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Is this a regression? Yes

Angular 5 Was not having this issue. Once we moved to Angular 7 we are facing this issue.
### Description
when we use ng lint for checkstyle it produces multiple xml content. This result in parsing failure of the xml.



## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
when i run this 
ng lint --format checkstyle > result-checkstyle.xml;

the result file contains : 
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><checkstyle version="4.3"><file name="../shoppingcart-ang7/shoppingcart/src/app/app.component.ts"><error line="208" column="160" severity="error" message="trailing whitespace" source="failure.tslint.no-trailing-whitespace" /></file></checkstyle>
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><checkstyle version="4.3"></checkstyle>

```

This result in xml parsing error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Ng lint produces to multiple xml content in single file" (#15608)

Issues.Title: Broken support for async/await
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular-devkit/build-angular > 0.802.2 ### Is this a regression? yes ### Description When building with target es2017 using @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.802.2, async/await functions work without problems. When using higher versions, they are surrounded with regeneratorRuntime, which is undefined. Issues.Title: [MdSelectionList/MatListOption] Add readonly support for items
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Right now only `disabled` is supported for items, which excludes the option if they were previously selected from the final result.

With `readonly`, the items wouldn't be able to be interacted with but if they were previously checked, then they make it to the final result.

#### Use Case

To have selection list with items visually stylized as readonly that cannot be checked/unchecked due some business conditions.

Reference: 

https://material.angular.io/components/list/api#MatListOption
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[MdSelectionList/MatListOption] Add readonly support for items" (#17141)

Issues.Title: cdk/DragDropModule cdkDropList cdkDragStartDelay breaks scrolling after first drag
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
Holding click/touch on draggable item for less than x seconds allows you to scroll by normally on touch device. Holding click/touch for x seconds or more triggers drag action for draggable item.

#### What is the current behavior?
It works as intended until an item is dragged for the first time. After dragging a draggable item, it no longer registers a click for scrolling. the item can still be moved after holding the click for x seconds, but it doesn't allow scroll. You can still scroll if you start the click event on a different draggable item that hasn't been moved yet.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-wzhhco

1. F12 to open chrome dev tools and toggle device toolbar to allow simulated mobile touch-scroll
2. quickly click and drag any of the test items in the draggable list to see it scrolls as intended
3. click and hold any of the test items for 200 milliseconds and drag to reposition
4. repeat step 2 on the same item you moved in step 3 to see it no longer scrolls
5. repeat step 2 on any item you haven't dragged to see it only appears to affect items which have moved


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
It doesn't really work if it only works once

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
For sure 8.2+, not sure beyond that.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I noticed this error sporadically when trying to scroll the already-moved item:

> drag-drop-registry.ts:199 [Intervention] Ignored attempt to cancel a touchmove event with cancelable=false, for example because scrolling is in progress and cannot be interrupted.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "cdk/DragDropModule cdkDropList cdkDragStartDelay breaks scrolling after first drag" (#17139)

Issues.Title: schematics: verify that generated code passes CLI's stricter compiler flags
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
PR https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/14905 introduces a new `strict` option to the Angular CLI. This option is currently `false` by default, but there are plans to make it `true` in version 9 or 10.

```json
    "noImplicitAny": true,
    "noImplicitReturns": true,
    "noImplicitThis": true,
    "noFallthroughCasesInSwitch": true,
    "strictNullChecks": true,
```
 
#### Expected Behavior
We need to make sure that all of the code generated by our Schematics will compile with these new flags.

We already use these flags for building the [library source](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/tsconfig.json) and [examples](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/cf70c4342e7ea277011cf289e721383b7784a18a/src/material-examples/tsconfig-build.json).

PR https://github.com/angular/material.angular.io/pull/631 adds these compiler flags for material.angular.io builds as well.

#### Related Issues
I'm not sure if this is something that we can do in integration tests (https://github.com/angular/components/issues/16479) or not. But it seems possible and would be needed to avoid introducing regressions over time.

https://github.com/angular/components/issues/13329 tracks making the library code follow even stricter checks (`--strictPropertyInitialization`).

https://github.com/angular/components/issues/16028 relates to stricter template checks in Ivy.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "schematics: verify that generated code passes CLI's stricter compiler flags" (#17135)

Issues.Title: Mat-Stepper: Setting selected index to dynamically added step causes exception
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cdafd9?file=app%2Fstepper-overview-example.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a mat-stepper component that renders mat-step elements from an array
2. Pass in the selected index from the component (initially set to 0)
3. Add a new element to the steps array for a dynamically added step and set the selected index to the new step index
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Would expect to navigate to the new step component that was just added and for the stepper header to update


#### Actual Behavior

The new step gets added as expected, but the updating of the selected index leads to an exception `Error: cdkStepper: Cannot assign out-of-bounds value to selectedIndex` - although the assigned index matches the last element in the array used to render the steps


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.6
- CDK/Material: 8.1.4
- Browser(s): Chrome 77
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Stepper: Setting selected index to dynamically added step causes exception" (#17134)

Issues.Title: feat(stepper): add input for controlling the animation duration
Issues.Body:
Adds a new input called `animationDuration` that allows users to control the animation duration of a stepper, similarly to other components.

Fixes #17130.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(stepper): add input for controlling the animation duration" (#17133)

Issues.Title: [MatStepper] Add support for custom animation duration timing
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Currently, transition between steps are fixed in the [`stepper-animation.ts`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/stepper/stepper-animations.ts#L30) (`225ms` to Vertical Stepper and `500ms` to Horizontal Stepper). It would be great to have an input for the `animationDuration` [the same way the MatTab component works](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/tabs/tabs-animations.ts#L37).

#### Use Case

When using an stepper it can look like this:

```
<mat-vertical-stepper #linearVerticalStepper="matVerticalStepper" [animationDuration]="500">
</mat-vertical-stepper>

<!-- or -->

<mat-horizontal-stepper #linearHorizontalStepper="matHorizontalStepper" 
                                       animationDuration="800ms">
</mat-horizontal-stepper>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[MatStepper] Add support for custom animation duration timing" (#17130)

Issues.Title: [Tabs] Make header pagination scroll faster
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Consider the following example: 
Browsing a page with 6 tabs on mobile (only 3 fit at a time).
To get to tab 6, you have to click the pagination arrow 3 times.
That's pretty slow. I would expect one click to show tabs 4, 5, 6.
You can try this on the first official [example](https://material.angular.io/components/tabs/examples) (add some tabs in StackBlitz).

![mat-tab-scrolling-slow](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5672108/65159595-07c93d80-da3d-11e9-9e47-159c9fc3693f.gif)

#### Use Case

Making the app more convenient on mobile.

#### More info

The scrolling is handled in `_scrollHeader()` method in [paginated-tab-header.ts](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/tabs/paginated-tab-header.ts#L395):
_"Move the scroll distance one-third the length of the tab list's viewport."_
The simplest solution would be replacing `viewLength / 3` with `viewLength` or `viewLength * 3 / 4`.
Another option is to make this fraction configurable through an `@Input` similarly to [animationDuration](https://material.angular.io/components/tabs/api).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Tabs] Make header pagination scroll faster" (#17129)

Issues.Title: Allow globally configurable Mat Paginator Defaults
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Similar to how MatAutocomplete has MAT_AUTOCOMPLETE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS, I'd love to see MatPaginator have default options for often globally-identical inputs such as `pageSizeOptions`,  `pageSize`, and `showFirstLastButtons`.

#### Use Case

Many enterprise applications are composed of large collections of paginated list views. For consistency, these lists often have identical defaults for pageSizeOptions and pageSize. Having to configure each list view with a global constant (which has to be re-declared in the component to get access to it on the template) is annoying and prone to errors.

MatAutocomplete has solved this issue with the MAT_AUTOCOMPLETE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS injection token, allowing us to globally configure the `autoActiveFirstOption` property.

This is a feature request for something similar to that, but for MatPaginator.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow globally configurable Mat Paginator Defaults" (#17123)

Issues.Title: dnd: dragging/sorting item in the nested cdkDropList always goes to the outermost cdkDropList
Issues.Body:
<!--------

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help: 

StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/angular-material2
Gitter: https://gitter.im/angular/material2
Google Groups: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2

Issues should capture only bug reports and feature requests. However, we understand that 
it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.

-------->


#### What are you trying to do?

Dragging or sorting inside/outside the nested droplist. 
Allow items in the nested droplist sorting inside/outside itself, even drag into the nested droplist of nested droplist and vice versa.
P/S: All droplists are linked to each other.

The current behaviour is that when to start dragging a nested list item, it will instantly get and move to the outmost container/droplist instead of within the nested droplist. It takes the outermost container because of the cursor is also located in it and according to **_getSiblingContainerFromPosition** function, it will take the first sibling container (which is outermost container) and ignore the inner containers.
Also, the function only considers getting the siblings and ignores the current container itself causing that we cannot do any sorting in the nested container and always move to the first outermost container.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I tried to modify the  **_getSiblingContainerFromPosition** which is not recommended solution.
I do not know is there any way to achieve it but it works perfectly after I modify the function.
**_updateActiveDropContainer** should call **_getContainerFromPosition** which includes current container itself and also sibling containers, and resort it ascending order by the number of the droplist contains (find function will get the innermost container first instead of the outermost container).

Please advise. Thank you so much :)

#### Reproduction

We can only help if we can reproduce the problem ourselves. 

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-dmuqfv?embed=1&file=app/zoo/zoo.component.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Items can be drag into another droplist.
2. Only items under the outer container can do the sorting.
3. When doing sorting for nested droplist items, it will move to the outer container.

P/S: Please ignore other buggy things since this sample code is to demonstrate for the mentioned issue only.
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 8
- CDK/Material: Drag and Drop
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows Server 2016
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "dnd: dragging/sorting item in the nested cdkDropList always goes to the outermost cdkDropList" (#17119)

  <mat-tab *ngFor="let tab of tabs; let index = index" [label]="tab">

    <button mat-raised-button
            class="example-delete-tab-button"
            [disabled]="tabs.length === 1"
            (click)="removeTab(index)">

</mat-tab-group>
```

Component Code is-
```
import {Component} from '@angular/core';
import {FormControl} from '@angular/forms';

/**
 * @title Tab group with dynamically changing tabs
 */
@Component({
  selector: 'tab-group-dynamic-example',
  templateUrl: 'tab-group-dynamic-example.html',
  styleUrls: ['tab-group-dynamic-example.css'],
})
export class TabGroupDynamicExample {
  tabs = ['First', 'Second', 'Third'];
  selected = new FormControl(0);

  addTab(selectAfterAdding: boolean) {
    this.tabs.push('New');

    if (selectAfterAdding) {
      this.selected.setValue(this.tabs.length - 1);
    }
  }

  removeTab(index: number) {
    this.tabs.splice(index, 1);
  }
}
```
